name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-Methoxybenzylidene group introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20. The methoxy group raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at +5. The oxazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, estimated at +20. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at +30. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and molecular volume, estimated at -5.
